sentence: These methanol extracts had the lowest transmittance at λmin of 520 nm (Figure 1).
Acetone extract lost its color during the 48 h of storage at 4 °C and showed maximum transmittance within the 400–700 nm range (Figure 1).
These methanol extracts had the lowest transmittance at λmin of 520 nm (Figure 1).
Acetone extract lost its color during the 48 h of storage at 4 °C and showed maximum transmittance within the 400–700 nm range (Figure 1).

Different letters for each parameter indicate significant differences at p ≤ 0.01 [25].The L* and a* values appeared to better explain the variations of colors created by different solvents (Figure 2A).
The acidified water was the next group in increasing L* and decreasing a* values, and this created a peach color (Table 2 and Figure 2A).
Therefore, acetone is in a separate group very far from other solvents with very low a* and b* values and high L* values (Figure 2A).
Acetone had the highest hue angle primarily due to the complete degradation of anthocyanins after storage for 48 h (Figure 2B).
Chroma was highest in methanol and methanol: water solvents [6,7,9] with an average of 36.5 (Figure 2B).
